intro: Nelitris rubra, commonly known as the red sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and clusters of small, pinkish-red flowers. Native to arid and semi-arid regions, this plant is adapted to survive in dry conditions. It typically grows in rocky soils and is often found in coastal areas. The plant's ability to store water in its leaves makes it a hardy species suitable for xeriscaping.
